subject: Non-existent axis causing interference - Pro X Pedals
description_text:
Hello,

I have the Pro-X pedals (including clutch) and have been having a 
problem for quite some time.
Since no patch has been released yet, I wanted to report it to you.

In the Windows controller settings and in all games, an additional axis 
is displayed, but it does not remain stationary and constantly jumps 
back and forth. I have attached a picture.

The problem is that this makes it very difficult for me to assign 
buttons and axes, as this axis is constantly being recognized because it 
is permanently sending signals.
And since this axis does not physically exist, it must be a 
software/firmware or hardware problem with the controller box.

Software: Simsonn Manager 2.1.0
Firmware controllbox: CPU1:v2.0.3 CPU2:v2.0.2

I am curious to know whether you are already aware of this.

Kind regards,
Andreas Kienle



Translated with DeepL.com (free version)

conversations.body_text: Hi Andreaas Kienle,     First, uninstall the old 2.1.0 version and install SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1. In the software, click Revert and then Save, and check whether the RX axis is disabled.  If the issue is still not resolved, try a manual firmware update: Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals-prox.sfu.  After completing the update, please test again.    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mS9dS2GyzhRYo81BcmTIOXY1POa6RvST/view?usp=drive_link

Great, it worked!

Thanks for the quick reply and help.
The RX axis is gone and everything is working as
it should.
